38609142.review: Enjoyable, lengthy HOG. Plenty of skippable cut scenes, lots of bonuses (collection items, morphing objects). Interactive map, customisable difficulty setting. A lot of care went into making this game. The story too supernatural for my tastes but I knew that when I bought it. Despite numerous shortcuts, skipping all scenes, I got over 8 hours play. Would have like a warning when skipping the final cut scene as I missed the ending of both the main story and the bonus but that's my fault. Overall: highly recommended for fans of the genre and for those who prefer a longer, more in-depth HOG.

38000002.review:
[h1]Short version: 74%[/h1]
High Voltage is a fun hidden object game that starts with incredible production values, but gradually loses its steam as it goes on—especially when we reach the bonus chapter.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Our snooping reporter, Laura returns with another serial murder case in the second episode of New York Mysteries, where all victims seem to have ties to a convict who met his end in the electric chair.
Unlike the previous (or next) game, High Voltage tries a pulp sci-fi theme, but it feels like as if the team was not comfortable without their usual fantasy elements, because the story quickly dies after the first few chapters, even struggling to reach a half-baked ending.

This uneasy feeling also seems to affect gameplay, as it is almost surprising how easy this game is, especially during the fabled hidden object scenes, which are—in true FIVE-BN fashion—more like single-screen puzzles than traditional item searches.
Maybe it is just luck, but this combination works in the game’s favour. The easy puzzles result in a tight, busy gameplay as we breeze through the waning story, ensuring that High Voltage manages to be fun enough to keep the player around until the end.

32213087.review:
If you enjoyed the first title in the New York Mysteries series, Secrets of the Mafia, then you will undoubtedly also enjoy this follow up to what, in my opinion, was a better game. I've yet to play the third in the series, however I must say that so far, I prefer the first game over this one for a few specific reasons, though it is still a wonderful game.

 If you have played these games before, then you are aware of how the HOS are very interactive; this was a pleasant experience in Secrets of the Mafia, however Lantern of Souls takes things to a much more extreme level, making nearly the entire HOS interactive, which isn't a big deal...UNLESS you make achievements for things like, oh, Clicking on 3 objects in 3 seconds in a HOS. Let me tell you, that achievement is darn near impossible in this game...it takes nearly 3 seconds just to open up an "investigative" window to find usually just one object.

 My only other real gripe about this game is that they did not include the solutions to the HOS and their puzzles,( because yes...they have puzzles in the scenes), in the guide that comes with all collector's edition games. Now, I understand most people don't even use these guides, and I rarely do myself, however, I had a few instances of being slightly stuck in some hidden object scenes in this game, and that has NEVER happened to me before. As there is an achievement for NOT using a hint at all during the game, I'd prefer not to have to rely on a hint, so the guide is kind of a nice thing to have...except when it only has half of the game in it.

 Regardless of my issues, this is still a beautiful, well made, wonderful game, and I do highly recommend it...just know that you might run into some of the same issues I have, and, well, maybe don't buy it for easy achievements, since they seem to be rather difficult to get. Of course, that could just be the user, not the product, lol.

32204205.review:
Pertty good. Although the hidden object scenes are all of the type 'find this to use on something else to open ...' kind of thing, which I don't really like so much. That's what the main game play is like anyhow, but not just in one scene.

I was going to go into a bit more detail. But having completed the main game (with all hidden objects and several other achievements) I reloaded the next day to do the bonus stuff and found about 80% of my progress had been wiped. Even the achievements (allthough these still appear in Steam). So a bit narked about that, tbh.

In addition, sometimes finding the hidden objects doesn't remove them from the map - although this didn't seem to stop me getting the achievement. And it seems as if clicking on the screen to speed dialog up counts as 'skipping' a scene. Annoying when you click on character because you think you need to interact with them and the first line of dialog is skipped.

I'm going to rate it +ve, though as I enjoyed the first run through, and now I've got some incentive to do it again at a later date.

29929708.review:
Elektrisierend... :)

… oh ja! Das ist hier im 2ten Teil der New York Mysteries durchaus wörtlich zu nehmen! Denn das trifft auf die Geschichte, die Optik und den Spielspaß gleichermaßen zu!! Five-BN sind übrigens auch die Entwickler der wunderbaren Lost Lands – Reihe und haben einfach ein Händchen für besonders plastische und lebendige Grafik mit sehr gut animierten Figuren: Hier sind wir im New York der 50er Jahre und ermitteln rund um besonders seltsame Todesfälle, die alle eines gemeinsam haben: Die Opfer waren alle 5 Jahre zuvor Zeugen und Beteiligte bei einer Hinrichtung eines Mörders durch den Elektrischen Stuhl…
FAKTEN: Eine sehr gute Spiellänge hat das Hauptspiel mit seinen 5 Kapiteln, das zudem sehr zufriedenstellend endet! Das Bonus-Kapitel ist die Vorgeschichte zum Spiel. Es gibt 3 wählbare Schwierigkeitsgrade, die aber jeweils noch benutzerdefiniert verändert werden können! Eine Transportkarte zeigt (falls gewählt) zuverlässig aktive Bereiche und ob noch Sammelobjekte in der Szene zu suchen sind. Der Tipp ist richtungsweisend. Dazu gibt es noch ein Journal und eine Aufgabenliste. Das Inventar ist feststellbar.
Die 11 WIMMELBILDER (plus 3 im Bonus-Kapitel) sind alle von der Art, dass Dinge nach Umrissen gesucht werden und wieder passend in die Szene eingesetzt werden, bis wir zum Schluss den Gegenstand fürs Inventar erhalten. Das ist hier immer sehr schön in einem ganzen Raum arrangiert und manchmal merkt man erst, dass man sich in einem Wimmelbild befindet, weil sich plötzlich nur noch Umrisse im Inventar befinden… Eingebaut sind auch immer kleine, nette Minispiele! Alle WB werden nur 1-Mal aufgesucht.
MINISPIELE gibt’s 15 (plus 6 im Bonus-Kapitel). Vom Schwierigkeitsgrad einfach bis mittelschwer: Es werden Blöcke verschoben, Übereinstimmungen auf 2 Bildern gesucht, falsch Liegendes wird richtig platziert, Kacheln in die richtige Aussparung verschoben, Rohre gedreht, bis ein Kreislauf entsteht und viele mehr…
EXTRAS: In jeder der 35 Szenen ist ein morphendes Objekt und ein Sammelgegenstand aus 4 verschiedenen Kategorien versteckt. Außerdem können noch 20 Dias gesammelt werden, die 20 Extra-Minispiele freischalten (Licht über Spiegel leiten). Dazu noch 6 Legepuzzles, etliche Auszeichnungen, Hintergrundbilder, Konzept-Kunst, Videos, Musik und Lösungsbuch.
Hier kann ich nur sagen: Ganz großes Kino – sehr bildgewaltig und spannend, dazu aufgabenreich und lang.

29857797.review: bonne intrigue tres bon jeux, plaisant

29833141.review:
First, the good things: This is a worthy successor of [I]New York Mysteries: Secrets of the Mafia[/I]. Same long and satisfying gameplay, same poorly constituted background story and backdrop (at least it doesn't get in the way), same bad voice acting. Note that it's not a typical hidden-object game: the hidden-object scenes involve finding objects by silhouette and using them together to solve puzzles. It's quite nice. There are also many mini-games, but they are invariably too easy.

The obnoxious part is the ads: the game actually pops up slides during gameplay reminding you to “rate” in on some site, and this is in addition to a pop-up slide every time you start the game. This poor managerial decision causes you to break immersion and roll your eyes. Can we please stop this nonsense?

Also, there is a bug with saving games: at some point, the game just wouldn't save for me when I quit normally, so next time I played I started way back at an old save. This problem persists to this day. So, I would recommend playing the whole in one sitting in order not to risk frustration.

29759954.review:
[h1]New York podruhé[/h1]
Opět dostanete příležitost vtělit se do krásné blondýnky, která vyšetřuje nadpřirozené případy. Jelikož je hra po technické stránce stejná jako první díl, odkážu vás na jeho [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/lonelyfirewolf/recommended/372930/]recenzi[/url]. Dodám jen, že grafika, hudba, hádanky, HOG scény a celková stylizace je naprosto parádní.

Hlavní změnou bude logicky jiný příběh. Trailer navozuje dojem, že to teď bude neméně zajímavé, jako když jste minule pátrali po dětech a mafiánech. Bohužel příběh je špatný. Není tak špatný, že byste jej přestali sledovat a hráli hru jen kvůli hádankám. Tvůrci se tu mohli pořádně vyřádit, nakonec ale zvolili opatrný postup, kdy většinu hry děláte věci, které nemají moc společného s hlavním záporákem. Klasicky se snažíte někam dostat a získat nějaký předmět, které jsou mimochodem opět dost často na místech, kde to nedává vůbec žádný smysl.

On smysl nedává moc ani příběh, kdy hlavní elektrický záporák má určité schopnosti, ale poté je jaksi nemá, protože scénář. Nit suchou nenechám ani na hrdince, která se místy chová otřesně. Vezměte si třeba první (z celkových dvou, kdy to druhé je až v poslední cutscéně...) setkání s oním záporákem. Má seznam obětí a myslí si, že všechny zabil. A co udělá hlavní hrdinka? Oznámí mu, že jeden z těch jeho cílů je stále naživu. Jako by tohle nestačilo, dá jí tento elektrický chlapík náramek, který má zmáčknout, až bude v blízkosti onoho cíle. A pozor, nemá na něj nic zkoušet, jinak ji zelektrizuje.

Celkem logicky se nabízí možnost, že by ji mohl sledovat ve el. rozvodné síti, což je schopnost, kterou ovládá a je to ukázáno ihned na začátku hry. Jenže i když se Laura setká s posledním přeživším, tak prostě... Náš Elektro tam není. Podobných kiksů je tu vícero, nejhorší snad ale je fakt, že příběh prostě nedokáže chytnout. Je nezajímavý, dokážete krásně odhadnout, co se stane.

A pak je to doplňkové dobrodružství. Opět tu je extrémně nevyužitý potenciál. Hrajete za otce onoho elektrického muže a snažíte se zachránit ženu, kterou unesl. Mezitím nalézáte vzkazy od vašeho syna a on vás peskuje za vaše chování k němu. Nuda. K tomu si připočítejte opět několik nelogických věcí a máte slušný obrázek o tom, že tento hodinový přídavek se nese v podobném stylu, jako základní hra.

Jako taková třešnička na dortu tu jsou bugy. Není jich moc, což potěší. Na druhou stranu jsem po dohrání doplňkového dobrodružství vypnul hru a po jejím opětovném zapnutí jsem zjistil, že se mi vymazala zhruba hodina hraní základní hry. Což s sebou nese i to, že mi uzamknula doplňkové dobrodružství.

Kvůli těmto faktům si hra zaslouží menší hodnocení než předchůdce. Samozřejmě to není vůbec špatná hra, ba naopak, je hodně dobrá, ale kvalita příběhu ji stahuje dolů do propasti průměrnosti.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ krásné grafické zpracování
+ hudba
+ atmosféra
+ originální a těžké hádanky
+ zajímavé HOG minihry
+ délka hry
+ množství bonusů

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- děj je předvídatelný a nezajímavý
- doplňkové dobrodružství nevyužívá plně svého potencionálu
- hodně nelogických věcí
- bugy

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 7/10[/b]

Hra si bohužel zaslouží menší hodnocení než předchůdce. Samozřejmě to není vůbec špatná hra, ba naopak, je hodně dobrá, ale kvalita příběhu ji stahuje dolů. Nebýt kvalitních hádanek a HOG scén, tak tenhle titul obdrží o dost nižší hodnocení.

I love the protagonists hairstyle. 

With that said, this games shows its great production value, voice and interactive scenery are very nice and easy to use. I've felt very engaged in following the games story line and working out the puzzles, the game is fairly easy and very enjoyable to play; the hints were very helpful. 
If you play off and on as I do, it was very easy to pick up where I left off and continue on my gameplay, I think this is a great game to play and I highly recommend it. :-)

28510829.review:
Empfehlenswertes Wimmel- und Rätselspiel. 

Es hat mich sehr gut unterhalten. Ich spiele diese Spiele immer auf dem höchsten Schwierigkeitsgrad und endlich hat mich mal wieder ein Spiel ins Grübeln gebracht. Danke dafür.

Die Rätsel in Verbindung mit der Story ist wirklich gut gelungen. Daumen hoch!
Besonders die Gegenstände die man einsammeln kann sind noch eine nette Nebenbeschäftigung. Eine richtige Herausforderung sind hier die 'Chamäleon-Objekte' :)

Das Einzige was ich etwas unglücklich finde ist, dass man viel später im Spiel, teilweise Gegenstände bekommt, die man für ein Rätsel ziemlich am Anfang benötigt. Weshalb einem nicht unbedingt gleich wieder einfällt, wozu der Gegenstand gut ist. Ich musste das ein oder andere Mal die komplette Map durchklicken, um mich wieder zu erinnern.

24770175.review:
Очень, ну ооочень годная казуальная игра на поиск предметов. Тут есть и детективно-приключенческий сюжет с элементами научной фантастики, и приятный саундтрек (лично знакомый мне по предыдущей части про мафию), и радующая глаз графика, и грамотная анимация, и интересные головоломки, и не надодоедающий (как в некоторых играх подобного жанра, в которые мне уже доводилось, к несчастью, играть) антагонист и бонус, раскрывающий предысторию произошедшего. Также очень порадовала пасхалка-отсылка к предыдущей игре, которая на данный момент является моей любимой среди игр подобного жанра.
В общем, вторая часть серии меня нисколько не разочаровала. Разработчики продолжают радовать, за что им огромнейшее спасибо (ну и не только, конечно //shut up n take my money!//*throws $$$ at FIVE-BN GAMES*). Игра действительно получилась захватывающей и интересной. Жду третьей части!

22164110.review: Отличная казуальная игра на поиск предметов. Оказалась довольно долгой, в сравнении с другими. Надо будет не мало по карте побегать, так как например можно найти предмет с 3 области в 15. Пазлы средненькие, можно решать без подсказок. Так же в игре можно (нужно) собирать коллекционные предметы, которые после прохождения откроют бонусы. В бонусах есть много всякого - обои, арты, саунды а также дополнительные мини-игры и пазлы. И это еще не считая дополнительной кампании. Отличная игра для любителей Hidden Object, затянет на пару вечеров.

21531443.review:
Though I'm not usually a fan of Hidden Object games, I found this one to be well worth my time. The storyline held various twists and turns that made it intriguing and the graphics are beautifully done. Instead of growing bored or irritated at the gameplay I found myself wanting more and eagerly played through the bonus chapter.

Even if you are one who isn't a fan of Hidden Object games, this game is bound to surprise and delight you. It's masterfully done and I don't regret buying it for a second.

21401139.review:
Supernatural terror has once again struck the big apple and it’s up to our heroine Laura to save the day. [i]New York Mysteries; High Voltage[/i] is a suspenseful hidden item game set in 1950′s New York City. It has a strong plot, great aesthetics and is full of tons of fun. [b]Can you help Laura solve the mystery before it’s too late?[/b]

People are dropping like flies and the police don’t have much evidence to go on, however witnesses claim to see a ball of light at the scenes of the crimes. The White Stone Order, a secret underground organization specializing in the paranormal, attempts to  solve the mystery from the shadows and invite Laura to help with her keen mind and investigative journalism skills. The story leads Laura on an adventure to stop a serial killer from exacting his revenge on those that tried to execute him. [b]Travel with Laura around New York City as you search for clues[/b] and find a way to bring this murderer down once and for all.

While the story itself is filled with thrills and sharp plot turns, the game also has lovely visuals to help keep you enthralled. All of the backgrounds are rich with color, the hidden object scenes are beautiful done and easy to see while still offering a challenge and the characters are very lively. The game also has well-animated cut scenes and [b]excellent voice acting.[/b] The game also has a beautiful score to listen to as you play.

Great scenes and puzzles offer a challenge which makes gaining all the achievements that much more rewarding. There is also [b]a bonus chapter that gives even more depth[/b] to the drama. The bonus content gives you access to wallpapers, videos from the game, concept art, re-playable mini games, puzzles and a brand new mini game! There a lot of in game items to collect as well during a play through. 

[i]New York Mysteries: High Voltage[/i] is a solid game that offers hours of enjoyment. The only issue I had while playing it was a saving glitch which forced me to replay the ending again, however, the issue seems to have been fixed with a recent patch at the time of this review. The developers were quick to fix the issue which shows, along with such an overall superb game, that they’re dedicated to their fans. [b]I highly recommend grabbing this title[/b], you won’t regret it.

[url=http://lunarproductions.tumblr.com/]Lunar Productions[/url]

21325764.review: war ein super Spiel war auch anspruchsvoll

21304700.review:
If you have played Secrets Of The Mafia, then you'll enjoy High Voltage, the eerie sequel!

I really appreciate the developers for preserving the art style and atmosphere in this entry of the franchise, I was worried that there would be too many drastic changes.

In this entry, Laura returns, now taken under the wing of The Order, an underground group of investigators that resolve paranormal crimes, uncover hidden mysteries, and preserve the secrets within New York City.
(And if you find all the hidden projector slides, you'll get to play more bonus puzzles, and you'll get to watch a bonus cutscene that delves a tiny bit more into The Order's origins!)
For her new case, Laura must uncover the truth behind a series of mysterious deaths - people who are zapped and turned to ash!

Also, just like in the previous game, I was thrilled to unlock and play a bonus chapter to the game.
Just like in the last game, the previous chapter acts as a prequel leading up to the events of the main game. I appreciate the length in gameplay and how nicely the chapter wrapped up. (In the last bonus chapter, there were a few plot holes. So this was a nice change!)

While I enjoyed this game, I sensed a change in theme...

Secrets Of The Mafia had a creepier vibe to it, and it also borrowed quite a number of noir themes to add to the mystery (Wandering the city at night, unsure of who to trust, conspiracy plots, etc.).

This game takes place almost entirely during the daytime (which was refreshing, don't get me wrong), and it was devoid of the noir feel. However, to make up for that, the new lore borrows a lot from Nicola Tesla's work and the mystery surrounding physics. So, instead of a noir crime mystery, you'll get to experience more of a sci-fi mystery.

~ . ~ .

+ Pros +

*6+ hours of gameplay

*Same lush, curious art style

*NEW areas of New York to explore

*MORE characters to interact with

*Additional game lore and character origins



- Cons -

*Still only have one save file
(You can create multiple profiles and start the game over that way, but if you play bits of the bonus chapter AND want to replay some of the main game, your save file will be overwritten. I kind of wish there was a chapter select and multiple save slots.)

*Voice acting
(Laura's voice was a bit unpolished, but it wasn't too unpleasant; just needs practice!)

*Abrupt ending
(The ending for the main game was pretty good, but it was a bit rushed, in my opinion. Also, I wish that there had been a bit of a 'wind down'; a time for Laura and Dr. Bishop to reflect on the case.)

~ . ~ . 

Overall, the game was a very relaxing and enjoyable experience.
It's a little pale compared to the previous game, but just as quirky as ever.

I've come to adore the franchise and I'm very hopeful for a sequel!

20628046.review: Gra automatycznie uruchamia się z aktywnymi podpowiedziami - wszystko co można obejrzeć, zebrać czy też dotknąć błyszczy się. Polecam od razu wyłączyć te funkcje. Tym bardziej, że gra jest bardzo prosta. Trochę się zawiodłem, bo myślałem, że trochę pogłówkuję, a tutaj zaskoczenie - nie było trudnych zagadek, a fabuła nie powalała. Takie dobre 2/10.

20626721.review:
Laura is back! After solving the mafia case, she's sent to investigate a series of strange murders. She discovers that it's a paranormal being that is behind these. Why? How can she stop that?

This time, the story is revolving around a man whose execution has gone so bad that the authorities never spoke about it. That's how the game is beginning. So you have to find how he disappeared and how come it's related to the murders. As usual, the game is mixing reality and paranormal and underground train as it's how you reach each location, like in the first game. You're working for Bishop, who was the one that asked for your help previously. The bonus chapter is about the father of the convict and how he tried to save his son to a death sentence.

Anyway, the gameplay is items to find, to combine, shapes scenes (let's say that maximum 5 of them may be harder to solve), puzzles (with some that are rare in the genre or combining several in one) and people to meet and discuss. It's not that I like the shape scene, however, I would have preferred some variety, like alternating with a list of hidden objects.

The developers are also the same as Lost Lands, so, yeah, given the fact that I've played three of their games nearly in a row, the first NY mysteries being weeks ago, I can't forget about the bonus contained in the opus: minigames to replay (new or familiar ones - practical to get timed or click counted achievements involving some of them), concept arts, music tracks, etc.. Besides, you have also objects to collect to unlock stuff: beyond objects (changing appearance) and four specific objects (Liberty Statue, cats, towers or balls) that are all in each scene. Besides, collecting diapositives is also explaining the background of the Order you're working for - though I have to confirm that because I didn't look about them.

Anyway, the graphics are quite good and diversified: from a prison to a lab that would have pleased Tesla (as the game is also based on what he discovered) without forgetting New York under the snow in the bonus chapter. And that soundtrack! I mean, it was giving me chills.

So, yeah, I can say that it's among these HO games that you need to play, as it's not boring and very well done. Perhaps the voice acting of Laura could be better..... but hey, I didn't regret my purchase. Go for it, seriously!

20496714.review: One of the more excellent HOG's I've played on Steam in a while. Great graphics, good story and good length. There is also Steam achievements which is nice too and not a bad price for a collector's edition compared to some of the others with outrageous prices.
